thread.title: Isles hand Sharks 1st loss
thread.title_full: Isles hand Sharks 1st loss - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Isles hand Sharks 1st loss
text:
Photo: Bruce Bennett Image 1 of / 1 1 NEW YORK, NY - OCTOBER 17: Kyle Okposo #21 of the New York Islanders celebrates his goal at 4:18 of the third period against the San Jose Sharks at the Barclays Center on October 17, 2015 in the Brooklyn borough of New York City. (Photo by Bruce Bennett/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 574711885 NEW YORK, NY - OCTOBER 17: Kyle Okposo #21 of the New York Islanders celebrates his goal at 4:18 of the third period against the San Jose Sharks at the Barclays Center on October 17, 2015 in the Brooklyn ... more Photo: Bruce Bennett Isles hand Sharks 1st loss 1 / 1 Back to Gallery New York
Kyle Okposo scored the tiebreaking goal early in the third period and added two assists as the New York Islanders beat San Jose 6-3 Saturday night, handing the Sharks their first loss of the season.
Johnny Boychuk , Anders Lee , Josh Bailey , Brock Nelson and Frans Nielsen also scored to help the Islanders win their third straight â€” all at their new Brooklyn home. Jaroslav Halak made his season debut after missing the first four games due to an undisclosed upper body injury and finished with 22 saves.
Lightning 2, Sabres 1: Ben Bishop set a team record for career wins, and Alex Killorn scored the go-ahead goal on a power play with 3:57 left. Tampa Bay also got a goal from Vladislav Namestnikov. Sam Reinhart scored his first NHL goal for the Sabres, who have scored once in three of their five games this season. Bishop won his 84th game with the Lightning, breaking a tie with Nikolai Khabibulin after making 31 saves. Chad Johnson made 20 saves for Buffalo.
Capitals 4, Hurricanes 1: Nicklas Backstrom had a goal and two assists in his season debut after missing the team's first three games while recovering from arthroscopic hip surgery in late May. T.J. Oshie added a goal and an assist, and John Carlson and Alex Ovechkin also scored as Washington tallied three in the third. Carolina goalie Cam Ward finished with 30 saves. Jeff Skinner scored Carolina's lone goal.
Stars 4, Panthers 2: Tyler Seguin and Jamie Benn scored two goals each to rally Dallas from a 2-0 deficit. Patrick Sharp had two assists and Jari Lehtonen stopped 22 shots to improve to 3-0-0. Aleksander Barkov and Brandon Pirri scored for Florida, and Roberto Luongo had 33 saves.
Penguins 2, Maple Leafs 1: Evgeni Malkin and Olli Maatta scored first-period goals and Marc-Andre Fleury , playing in his 600th career game, made 26 saves as Pittsburgh won its sixth straight against Toronto. Jake Gardiner scored his second goal in as many nights for Toronto, which has lost four of five to begin the season. Jonathan Bernier , making his first start, stopped 31 shots.
Canadiens 4, Red Wings 1: Jeff Petry scored the go-ahead goal 6:32 into the third and Montreal moved to 6-0 for the first time in franchise history. Brendan Gallagher , Tomas Plekanec and Brian Flynn also scored. Rookie Dylan Larkin scored for Detroit, which lost its second in a row.
Predators 4, Senators 3 (SO): James Neal scored twice in regulation and had the shootout winner. Craig Smith also scored for Nashville. Carter Hutton, making his first start of the year, stopped 38 shots. Mike Hoffman had a pair of goals for the Senators (3-2-1), while Mark Stone picked up the other. Craig Anderson had 22 saves.
Blackhawks 4, Blue Jackets 1: Artem Anisimov and Teuvo Teravainen scored 1:05 apart late in the second to break a scoreless tie, and Chicago handed Columbus its sixth straight loss. Marian Hossa added a power-play goal in the third and had an assist. Patrick Kane had an empty-net goal. Columbus' Jack Johnson scored with 3:39 left to spoil Corey Crawford 's shutout bid. Crawford finished with 22 saves. Curtis McElhinney started in goal for Columbus over Sergei Bobrovsky and made 26 saves.
